SENT.plain: Bone marrow from a patient with aplastic anemia was shown by multiple criteria to have a block in early myeloid differentiation
This block was overcome in vitro by elimination of marrow lymphocytes
Furthermore, this differentiation block was transferred in vitro to normal marrow by coculturing with the patient's marrow

We suggest that some cases of aplastic anemia may be due to an immunologically based suppression of marrow cell differentiation rather than to a defect in stem cells or their necessary inductive environment
